pullRequest.body:
* Add a lemma stating that non-identity element of a finite group of prime order generates the group (stated in 4 ways)
* Use this to golf `isCyclic_of_prime_card`
* Add a version of `isUnit_iff_exists_inv` for non-commutative monoids.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: This will conflict with #10831. If one is merged, the other PR should merge master.
Yes, there is a conflict. I don't care which PR gets merged first.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8004845019/job/21863018320)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8004845019/job/21863017815)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8004845019/job/21863017542)

I imagine that the `to_additive` names explicitly provided here will become superfluous once #10831 gets merged, right?

If so, then I think that it might be better to wait for the other PR and merge this one afterward, with the enhanced `to_additive` translations.
Is this the same lemma as the one in #10719 (not merged, yet)?
Not, exactly (one existential vs two), but I might be happy with that one as well.

Ah, of course!  I am happy with having both lemmas, although ideally they should end up next to one another and, even better, have doc-strings mentioning each other.  This may simply be the job of a PR following the merging of the two existing PRs.

```suggestion
theorem mem_powers_of_prime_card {G : Type*} [Group G] {_ : Fintype G} {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact p.Prime]
```
or is there a reason for using the explicit universe?
Why are you using `{_ : Fintype G}` instead of `[Fintype G]`?
Then it can sometimes be figured out from the type of `h`, even if this argument is not an instance. I don't think it's very important.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: cyclic group lemmas
